results.deck: Dingo Pictures' movie/jigsaw/coloring book combo comes to PS2.
results.name: Dalmatians 3

results.deck: A street racing game for the PlayStation 2.
results.name: Drag Racer USA

results.deck: Empire of Atlantis is a European puzzle game on the PS2.
results.name: Empire of Atlantis

results.deck: Sprint through obstacle courses in a post apocalyptic Earth in the year 3010.
results.name: Extreme Sprint 3010

results.deck: Girl zone is a game about a zone in which girls' heads sometimes grows among flowers under a two color rainbow in space maybe. It was probably only released in PAL territories. It is also the greatest game of all time. ask anyone.
results.name: Girl Zone

results.deck: After a mole awakes from a deep slumber he sees that the world around him has changed dramatically. His hole has been converted into a huge laboratory filled with deadly monsters. Now its up to you to help mole destroy the laboratory and take back what is rightfully his.
results.name: Maniac Mole

results.deck: Monster trucks don't get more extreme or more offroad than this.
results.name: Monster Trux Extreme Arena Edition

results.deck: Try to reach the end of the level while being trapped in an orb of doom
results.name: Myth Makers: Orbs of Doom

results.deck: Touge 3 (titled Road Rage 3 outside of Japan) moves the touge street racing franchise from CAVE and Atlus to the PS2.
results.name: Road Rage 3
Snow White and the 7 Clever Boys

results.deck: A deliberately over-the-top wrestling game for the Playstation 2.
results.name: WWC: World Wrestling Championship

results.deck: A value title from Phoenix Games.  This title contains four arcade style racing games.
results.name: Xtreme Speed

results.deck: Originally released in PAL regions as Urban Freestyle Soccer, it was released in the US exclusively through Blockbuster as Freestyle Street Soccer.
results.name: Freestyle Street Soccer

results.deck: K-1 World GP 2005 is a Kickboxing game, developed and published by D3, which was released in Japan in 2005.
results.name: K-1 World GP 2005

results.deck: K-1 World GP 2006 is a Kickboxing game, developed and published by D3, which was released in Japan in 2006.
results.name: K-1 World GP 2006

results.deck: K-1 World Grand Prix 2001 is a Kickboxing game, developed by KCEJ and published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 2001.
results.name: K-1 World Grand Prix 2001

results.deck: K-1 World Grand Prix 2003 is a Kickboxing game, published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 2003.
results.name: K-1 World Grand Prix 2003

results.deck: K-1 World Grand Prix: The Beast Attack! is a Kickboxing game, published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 2003.
results.name: K-1 World Grand Prix: The Beast Attack!

results.deck: K-1 World Max 2005 is a Kickboxing game, developed and published by D3, which was released in Japan in 2005.
results.name: K-1 World Max 2005

results.deck: The second in the Moe Moe World War II offshoot of the Daisenryaku series of strategy games, where WWII is reimagined with anime girl-based units.
results.name: Moe Moe 2-ji Daisenryaku 2 [chu]

results.deck: The second game in the Sengoku Ace series. (Also known as Tengai.)
results.name: Sengoku Blade: Sengoku Ace Episode II

results.deck: The first game in the Sengoku Ace series.
results.name: Samurai Aces

results.deck: Japan-only release that focuses more on huge armies rather than a small group of heroes.
results.name: Spectral Force Radical Elements

results.deck: The Seed: War Zone was an early Japanese PlayStation 2 sci-fi strategy RPG which took place in space, and featured battling spaceships. Released in 2001, it was later saw a 2003 release in Europe.
results.name: The Seed: War Zone

results.deck: This was a PS2 volleyball game featuring anime characters, based around a world cup of indoor volleyball.
results.name: Volleyball Challenge

results.deck: Winning Post World 2010 is a horse racing simulation game developed by Koei. It is a part of the long running Winning Post series and was released in Japan on February 26, 2010.
results.name: Winning Post World 2010

results.deck: The first attempt to make an online game out of the offline online game series .hack. Only released in Japan.
results.name: .hack//fragment

results.deck: Sega's NCAA basketball game for the 2003 season. It would be 2K4 chronologically. Former Texas Longhorn guard, T.J. Ford was on the cover.
results.name: ESPN College Hoops

results.deck: A "what do you call them, press O alot, read japanese and make choises ocationaly" game based on ARIA.
results.name: Aria the Natural

results.deck: The second Ps2 game based on the ARIA anime. This one beeing based on the final part of the anime going by the same name.
results.name: Aria the Origination: Aoi Wakusei no El Cielo

results.deck: You take on the Role as Ruff Trigger a bounty hunter, sent to rescue Piglots. RPG
results.name: Ruff Trigger: The Vanocore Conspiracy

results.deck: Emperor Bog, annoyed with the Butt Ugly Martian's messing up his plans decides to throw a cross galaxy race to decide the fate of earth.
results.name: Butt-Ugly Martians: Zoom or Doom

results.deck: TVDJ is an action/rhythm game that was only released in Japan by SCEI. An impressive early PS2 game, it has cel-shaded graphics and is fully voice acted. Unfortunately, the game is only a a handful of short 5-minute stages that end up feeling more like a mini-game.
results.name: TVDJ

results.deck: Avoid the ground by freezing and grappling onto your enemies, using momentum and physics to stylishly save the day in 2.5D action!
results.name: ChainDive

results.deck: Stepping Selection is a rhythm game published by Jaleco for the PlayStation 2. The game features popular songs, but uses shortened cover versions of them instead of the original recording.
results.name: Stepping Selection

results.deck: Splatter Master is a somewhat gory side-scrolling brawler on the PS2 developed by Vingt-et-un Systems.
results.name: Splatter Master

results.deck: The 2010 edition of the very popular (in Japan) Nippon Professional League (NPB) baseball game. This year marks the series' last appearance on PlayStation 2 and first on PSP.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 2010

results.deck: The game based off of the film of the same name
results.name: Despicable Me: The Game

results.deck: The cancelled sequel to Outcast
results.name: Outcast II: The Lost Paradise

results.deck: Fighting game on the PS2 based on the Kinnikuman manga and anime series.  It is the home version of the arcade game, Kinnikuman Muscle Grand Prix.
results.name: Kinnikuman Muscle Grand Prix MAX

results.deck: A hexagonal turn-based strategy game based on the Earth Defense Force series.
results.name: Global Defence Force Tactics

results.deck: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction is the latest Ben 10 video game set during the events of Ben 10: Ultimate Alien.
results.name: Ben 10 Ultimate Alien: Cosmic Destruction

results.deck: A licensed game where you control the Giant Robo character and fight other giant robots.  Similar to other games developed by Sandlot.
results.name: Giant Robo: The Animation

results.deck: 3rd person shooter for PS2 and Xbox (PAL only). Based on 80s hit TV-series.
results.name: Miami Vice

results.deck: Simplistic 3d versus fighter for PS2 with all-female cast and an emphasis on breast physics. Released only in Europe and in Japan as Simple 2000 Series Vol. 55: The Catfight: Joneko Densetsu.
results.name: Fighting Angels

results.deck: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011, also known as Winning Eleven 2011, and usually shortened to PES 2011 or WE 2011, will be the new installment in Konami's strongly followed football (soccer) series. It will be released on September 30th in Europe, and on October 5th in the US.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011

results.deck: SingStar: The Wiggles is a collection of popular songs from the Wiggles.  The Wiggles are an Australian children's band who have shared their music with kids around the world.
results.name: Singstar: The Wiggles

results.deck: Mobile Suit Gundam: One Year War is an action game based on the Mobile Suit Gundam franchise. Like many Gundam games before it, it portrays the events of the original 1979 anime.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: One Year War

results.deck: A side-story based on Mobile Suit Gundam. It follows a team of grunts fighting during the iconic One Year War.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Lost War Chronicles

results.deck: This Japan-exclusive game is the first to be based on the Gundam SEED franchise. It is a 2.5D action game that faithfully follows the plot of the show.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED

results.deck: A mecha action game based on the live-action movie of the same name.
results.name: G-Saviour

results.deck: Scooby-Doo and the gang are back on the Wii, DS, and PlayStation 2 to solve the mystery of a strange swamp girl and her cauldron of magical brew.
results.name: Scooby-Doo! and the Spooky Swamp

results.deck: 2K's long-running basketball simulator is back for another season with Michael Jordan as their cover athlete.
results.name: NBA 2K11

results.deck: TD Overdrive is a racing game, part of the Test Drive series. It was released for the Xbox, PlayStation 2 and Windows platforms.
results.name: TD Overdrive: The Brotherhood of Speed

results.deck: Spike has to to suck the pants off the monkeys to clean them.
results.name: Pipo Saru 2001

results.deck: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011 is the twelfth installment of the popular wrestling series and introduces a brand new physics system to the gameplay as well as a new WWE Universe mode.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2011
